judgement: The person who tried to connect their personal experience of being invalidated by a parent to the broader cultural issue of valuing material goods over homemade presents is more in the right than the one who dismissed their concerns and implied they were being overly dramatic.
steering: It's clear we're all coming from different places. Maybe we can focus on supporting OP and acknowledging the complexity of their feelings rather than trying to one-up each other with our own experiences?
